item.title: Perceiving Personality Through the Grapevine: A Network Approach to Reputations
Longitudinal Stability and Change in the Big Six
Ethics-Relevant Values in Adulthood: Longitudinal Findings from the Life and Time Study
Revealed Traits: A Novel Method for Estimating Cross-Cultural Similarities and Differences in Personality
Stability and Change in the Big Five and Big Six: New Tests of the Maturity and Cumulative Continuity Principles
Personality Stability & Change (Life & Time)
item.description: The Life and Time project is an NSF-funded project run by Gerard Saucier and Sanjay Srivastava (NSF Grant # 0921842). It is a 4-year study and follows an accelerated longitudinal design. I have worked with this data to examine change and stability in the Big Six and other constructs across the adult lifespan.

item.title: Twitter Project
item.description: The twitter project consists of NIH- (Grant # MH106879) and NSF-funded (GRANT # 1551817; PI: Sanjay Srivastava) research examining how mental health, personality, and reputation are manifest on Twitter and recoverable from corresponding digital records of behavior (i.e., followed accounts, tweets, etc.).

item.title: What a _____ Thing to Do! Formally Characterizing Actions by Their Expected Effects
